title: Ascendas REIT picks up new Nissan HQ for $111m
text:
Singapore property giant Ascendas REIT has joined the rush of investors pouring money into suburban office property after striking a $110.9 million deal to buy a new eight-level building in Melbourne's south-east that will serve as the new national headquarters for carmaker Nissan.

The 17,500 square metre development at 254 Wellington Road in Mulgrave, about 21 kilometres from the centre of Melbourne, is a joint venture between Asia-based real estate platform ESR and Frasers Property Australia. The building is due for completion in the second quarter of 2020.

A render of the new Nissan HQ at Mulgrave being developed by ESR and Frasers

The fund-through deal was struck on an initial yield of 5.8 per cent excluding transaction costs and 5.7 per cent inclusive of transaction costs.

Nissan will occupy 65 per cent of the new building on a 10-year leasing deal. The remaining rental income is secured by a three-year rental guarantee provided by the vendors.

"This will be our fourth suburban office property in Australia," said William Tay, chief executive of Ascendas Funds Management, the manager of Ascendas REIT.
description: The fund-through deal was struck on a yield of 5.8 per cent and follows a string of big ticket sales in the Melbourne suburban office market as investors chase yield.
